definition:
The logical operator xor, short for “exclusive or”, is a binary operator
that is true iff exactly one of its parameters is true, and thus
corresponds to the normal use of “or” in English. Xor uses the symbol
$\oplus$ due to its similarity to disjunction, which sometimes uses $+$.
The truth table for xor is

   $a$   $b$   $a \oplus b$
  ----- ----- --------------
    F     F         F
    F     T         T
    T     F         T
    T     T         F
